Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Moringa \Mo*rin"ga\, prop. n. [Malayam murunggi.] (Bot.) A genus of trees of Southern India and Northern Africa. One species ({Moringa pterygosperma}) is the horse-radish tree, and its seeds, as well as those of {Moringa aptera}, are known in commerce as {ben} or {ben nuts}, and yield the oil called {oil of ben}. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Ben \Ben\, Ben nut \Ben" nut`\ . [Ar. b[=a]n, name of the tree.] (Bot.) The seed of one or more species of moringa; as, oil of ben. See {Moringa}. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Ben \Ben\, adv. & prep. [AS. binnan; pref. be- by + innan within, in in.] Within; in; in or into the interior; toward the inner apartment. [Scot.] [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Ben \Ben\, n. [See {Ben}, adv.] The inner or principal room in a hut or house of two rooms; -- opposed to {but}, the outer apartment. [Scot.] [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Ben \Ben\ An old form of the pl. indic. pr. of {Be}. [Obs.] [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Bene \Bene\, Ben \Ben\, n. [Native name.] (Zo["o]l.) A hoglike mammal of New Guinea ({Porcula papuensis}). [1913 Webster]
ben n : a mountain or tall hill; "they were climbing the ben"
